qas.question: When did the active persecution of religious services become more of a restricted tolerance?
Religious services for other religions were tolerated as long as they adhered to what rule?

answers.text: as long as their services took place secretly in private churches

qas.question: When did persecution of religious services take place secretly in private churches?
During what period did services move to a state of tolerance?
What changed from religious services to private churches?
What was actively persecuted when taking place in private churches?
Where was active persecution taking place?

context: <b3_0>Beginning <a0_0><b2_0>in the 18th century<b3_0/><b2_0/><a0_0/>, <b4_0>the situation<b4_0/> changed from more or less active persecution of <b5_0>religious services<b5_0/> to a state of restricted toleration of other religions, <a1_0>as long as their services took place <b6_0>secretly in private churches<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
